name: Weston Oliver
text: Restaurant was disgusting. Bathrooms had not been cleaned in weeks and smelled like an outhouse, food was sub par at best. Staff apparently never cleans anything as everything there was gross and sticky. Do not go. I am reporting to health department.

resp.text: Weston, thank you for the feedback, and I regret that this was your experience. This is not our Dickey's standard. Please reach out to me at socialmedia@dickeys.com so that we may learn more of your visit and can address these issues. Thank you, Ann, Social Team.

name: Eric
text: Great pork sandwich.... Onion might have been a little to over powering though?  :)

name: Christopher Merchant
text: Great food, home style surrounding, wonderful service. Also live radio broadcast makes for great entertainment.

name: Rickey Giddeon
text: I can't believe the bad comments I read. This place food is great. Some say it's pricey. They have good deals each day and anywhere in town BBQ is expensive. It's very reasonable here and the customer service is great.

name: Jeremy English
text: A little pricey, but the food is a solid 9 out of 10. Perfect pulled pork, excellent sauces, jalapeno beans are kinda thick & really tasty. Good comfort food!

name: Sharon Sparks
text: I visited in your place of business on 02/16/2019 @ 6pm and ordered a small bbq sandwich, the individual that waited on me was very rude, didn't greet with any friendliness, just complained they had been busy all day. As he began preparing my sandwich, I noticed the bun was really small, I questioned that and it was told they were store bought and that the normal buns were frozen, so I said why charge the same amount for a smaller sandwich, and he stated to me after I ask for my money back, that he would give me two, okay then he stopped making my sandwich and didn't even explain that he would be back in a minute and when I looked around the corner he was standing there on his cell phone, and used only one glove to continue, I said shouldn't you have on two gloves, he stated I didn't feel like putting the other on. So I ask him did they not put onions on the sandwiches anymore,  and he stated yes, so he grabbed a knife that had been hanging on the wall, so I thought he was going to clean it, it was already dirty, I said are you going to clean that, he stated to me, very nasty, its what I have used all day, I said, I don't care, don't use it on my food, he then he got mad and stated to the other employee who was standing there, finish this order and then I really wanted my money back, He stated he didn't want to fool with the register, so I ask for corporate number, and he stated I am corporate, I stated okay, but I am going to take this further than you, I took those sandwiches and fed them to my dog. Its awful nasty in the 69S Tuscaloosa, Al Dickeys, the cashier was nice, and very apologetic, and I thanked him and he was a younger male,

resp.text: mattie, thank you for the feedback, and I regret that this was your experience. This is not our Dickey's standard. Please reach out to me at socialmedia@dickeys.com so that we may learn more of your visit and can address these issues. Thank you, Marin, Social Team.

name: Lesley Carter
text: Angela was amazing!  She was working by herself so she was cooking the food and waiting on people. Our ribs were tender and delicious along with the pulled pork sandwich. Our best trip so far!

name: Kristie Reine Ring
text: The food was great but more importantly the service was amazing!   The kindness and helpfulness of the staff was above and beyond amazing.  Our family appreciates the well done meal and great environment!

name: Greg Randall
text: I had a pork sandwich; it was fine.  The BBQ sauce is too sweet.  The Fried Onion Tanglers are phenomenal.

name: Reginald Eatmon
text: Great place especially for the kids. Great food and friendly employees. Will be back soon.

name: James Smith
text: They have always been very courteous and the food especially the ribs beat out dreamland ten to one. As for pricing as good as anyone else in tuacaloosa maybe better.

name: Linda Wilson
text: Great food, nice environment, employees engaging, friendly, and helpful.

name: Leslie A Thomas
text: Was disappointing.  They were out of chicken nuggets, ice cream maker wasn't working and their drinks we're running out while we were there.

resp.text: Leslie, I am disappointed to hear about your experience at Dickey's. I would appreciate it if you would email me at socialmedia@dickeys.com with more details from your visit. Thanks, Marin, Social Team.

name: Jessica F
text: Food is good, but 69 south location workers are RUDE RUDE RUDE. No respect for customers, always rolling their eyes or talking smack about someone else that works there. SO UNPROFESSIONAL. It is AWFUL. Will not be back.

name: Evelyn Barnette
text: Ordered takeout tonight and it was terrible. I think the coleslaw was out of date. The ribs tasted like they were a week old too. Will not be back. I pray I don’t have food poisoning.

resp.text: Hi Evelyn, we are sad to see that you were not satisfied with your experience ordering from Dickey's. I would appreciate it if you sent me an email to socialmedia@dickeys.com with your contact information. - Ann, social team

name: Donald Dickson
text: It's was ok. But the meat wasnt hot, it was barely warm. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

name: Nelda Hudgins
text: Tasty food but a bit more expensive than lunch at other BBQ places.

name: Bean and Bugs Mom
text: Given this place too many chances to impress me. If you go, go for meat only. I just had to convince the cashier that a yeast roll was included with my meal-really? I bought $30 worth off bbq and youre going to argue with me about a yeast roll...when it says on your sign that its included with the meat?? This place typically runs out of everything, so go early if you go at all. And dont be suprised if something is left out of your togo bag- has happened twice before- which is why I checked on the roll this time!

name: Ella Hood
text: Ribs and Smoked Turkey were over salted when we ate there last

name: Joy Elinburg
text: Wonderful people and great food. Nuf said.

name: Doug Stetson
text: Great service great food

name: nckalx
text:
Ribs were not very good, food was very overpriced... $15 for a plate that consisted of 5 ribs and two inexpensive, underwhelming sides.

Extra star for the free ice cream.

name: Tim Richey
text: Great bbq. Got to get a yellow cup.

name: Madaca 99
text: Decent BBQ, but it's not, well, you know.

name: V Moore
text: Dickie's is always good

resp.text: Vernon, thank you so much for the high star review! Come back and see us soon! -Marin, Social Team.

name: Steven Baird II (Woodsman)
text: Best BBQ I ever had

name: Thomas Shappley
text: Tried to go there for lunch today and it was out of business.

resp.text: We are working hard to re-open this location. Thanks!

name: Steve Buchheit
text: Dickies on 69 S is great.

name: Savannah McMillan
text: Really good food it's just really expensive.

resp.text: Hi Savannah! Please come back, try us again and ask about our daily deals. Have a great day!

name: Vickie Mitchell
text: love their bbq

name: chris fowler
text: Food was cold...to much fat on brisket...chicken had no taste..

name: Cheryl Stringer
text: Great service..

name: Jamie lou Purser
text: Food is fine there customer service is bad the food sever gave dirty looks entire time I was trying to order they rolled there eyes a lot they shouldn't be in business if they want to be rude

name: Donovan Gee
text: One of my faves.

resp.text: We're honored to be one of your favorites!

name: Angela Mott
text: Delicious!

resp.text: Angela, we appreciate your positive review about your recent visit to Dickey's Barbecue Pit! We look forward to your next visit!

name: Kevin Bailey
text: AWESOME

resp.text: Kevin, we're honored you think so highly of our barbecue! See ya again next time! - Ann, social team

name: Love Abrams
text: good

name: Raymond Tidmore
text: I'm

resp.text: We're honored that you went out of your way to leave us a review! See you again soon! - Ann, social team

name: Barbara Welch
text: GREAT!!!

resp.text: Barbara, we appreciate your positive review about your recent visit to Dickey's Barbecue Pit! We look forward to your next visit! -Ellen, Social Team.

name: JaKierra Lee
text: Delivery service is awesome. Great fresh fruit and veggies like I would pick! Plus it helps me when i just dont have time!

name: Keayandra King-Collins
text: The food was amazing!!!! Meat was falling off the bone and the sides were just as equally good as the rib plate. The prices were great for all the food you can get. Also, we went on a Sunday and my son was able to eat free and he was pleased with his food as well. Whenever I'm in Tuscaloosa I am definitely going there again!

name: Samuel-Imãn “King Network” Simpson
text: Well foods not bad for the price I had the double cheese and waffle fries and Mac and cheese. Great job! The sauce sucks though.

name: Jonathan Brown
text: Best BBQ in Tuscaloosa. Friendly staff and excellent service. Daily deals are a great price.

name: Bentlleyy
text: Everytime i eat here it is spotless. Even the frier! Never messed up one of my orders and I eat here all the time! Great customer service!

name: Adam Acosta
text: Good food for the price. sides are consistently good. nice people.

name: Raquel T Green
text: Everything was prepared perfect, great selection of the meats, sides, and sauces. Definitely will be returning often and soon!!!

name: Jack Simmons
text: Food was good and the owner and staff very friendly.

name: Kevin Ray
text: The food was ok and service but the price was way to high. Eat the same thing at Dickies on hwy 69 almost 20$ difference. And think the food is a lot better on hwy 69. 5 star there all around good

name: EAZY E
text: terrible

name: Alex ross
text: Never come here!!!

name: John Williams
text: Worst BBQ I've had in Tuscaloosa

name: John Davis
text: The owner is a dbag

name: Roll Tide
text: Nasty dry food!!!!!

name: mbisme
text: Overpriced BBQ

name: James Patillo
text: I'm just here for the brownies.

name: William Arnold
text: Worst BBQ I've had in Tuscaloosa, rude staff. Don't recommend you go and I won't be returning.

name: Anthony P.
text: Visited these guys today. Had the Willis Burger and Truffle fries, wow, delicious. Highly recommend this place. Best tasting lunch from a truck you will ever have.

name: Stu F
text: I enjoy everything shindigs has to offer. The people are always friendly and helpful. The entire menu is delicious, from the truffle fries to the catfish bou rolls. Thanks for all the great food.

name: Kay Roney
text: Attended a party catered by Shindigs.  Over the top.  The most creative and delicious appetizers and cocktails and a superbly prepared meal!

name: Courtney Harkness
text: Tried asking for a quote to cater a small party (150-200 people) and just told us they weren't interested in helping...

name: Carrie Rollwagen
text:
Shindigs is incredible. I normally get a burger and truffle fries because they're so delicious, but I've also had other things on the menu, including salad, and everything I had showed a really good balance of flavors and was really unique. This is the kind of food that is where cravings come from -- I've been known to leave my desk during an incredibly busy day at work just because I saw Shindigs tweet their menu.

Shindigs is a food truck, but they do provide everything you'll need to enjoy your meal: napkins, flatware, drinks, and a picnic table. (You may want to scout out more seating if the table is full, of course.)

They also do a fantastic job at catering -- I've been known to sneak more than a couple mini grilled cheese sandwiches off of caterer trays when they weren't looking just to have one more bite. I'm not proud of this, but it's just that good.

name: Alex
text: While I didn't enjoy the meal I got from their food truck (I belive their cook just got a bit heavy handed with the salt), I did enjoy the quick and efficient customer service I got once I wrote a review to them. The company apologized and returned my money. I would definitely try it again. I believe the nachos would have been delicious had it not been for the extra saltiness.

resp.text:
Thank you, again, for your constructive criticism!!! We would LOVE to see you again soon!!!
-The Shindigs Crew

name: Glen White
text: Great menu choices

name: Matt Johnson
text: Ran into this gem at Railroad Park.

name: Guy Incognito
text: There's not much you probably don't already know about a sub sandwich shop, but this Lenny's location certainly has a great staff and great food.  I've always loved the clean taste of their Italian and Classic subs.  This location also does a great job of keeping the place clean.

name: connie garcia
text: This Lenny's is ALWAYS dirty! My husband goes but I will not eat there. The tables are dirty, the floors, and the machine they use to slice the meat with is dirty. Compared to other Lenny's this one is not up to standard. The employees are standing around or on their phone. One person doing the work while others do nothing.  I hope the owner or manage changes this because I love Lenny's subs but I don't want to get sick eating in a dirty restaurant.

name: Wes McKay
text: Just well-made, tasty, flavorful sandwiches.  I love the pepper relish on top of a sandwich made Lenny's way.  The rewards program is another major plus.

name: Heather Hill
text: I hate to say this because I believe in having a light hearted atmosphere in your work environment but they do it a little too much where they screw up orders. The first time I was there I had order for take out and they were busy and 5 people before me ended up getting the order wrong they even got one table's order wrong twice. Then I get my order and I checked it just to make sure and sure enough they had gotten my order wrong and it's because the whole time the workers are constantly joking around with each other that they aren't paying attention to what they are doing. Then the second time I order a sandwhich and salad and I was an idiot not to check my bag because they didn't even put it in the bag and it was the main thing I wanted out of the whole order because it was for my paralyzed grandfather who I take care of full time. I get him Lenny's as a treat and don't get much time to get away from the house for this and the manager really didn't act like it was a big deal. We pay good money for your sandwhiches I shouldn't have to waste gas to correct your screw ups just because you think it's better to not be focused on job. I will never return to them. I have even had other people tell me they stopped going to Lenny's because they always screw up their order because of the joking around. Get it together.

name: connie waddell
text: Great we haven't eat there is a while we ate there today it was great. The bread is far better then any other sub shop.

name: Kenny B
text: Owner is friendly, staff isn't. Food quality is poor and there were a ton of flies inside. Go to subway instead.

name: Sharon Heinz (Profit Wise Accounting)
text: I am very picky about subs and sandwich meat.   This Lenny's is great!  If you want a good sub try Lenny's!

name: Steven B.
text: When I was looking for a local place to get a great philly - I found Lenny's. Everyone in there is nice and the food is always great and fresh.

name: Chris Hardy
text: Lenny's is the best sandwich shop in the Greater Huntsville area. Anytime I'm in Madison, I make a point to stop by.

name: George Ford
text: Italian sub, signature hot pepper relish, jalapeño chips, and the simplicity of the menu make this one of my favorite sub shops.

name: Andrew Lynn
text: Lennys is good, this lennys is an adult daycare... Not even an ounce of professionalism

name: Reddy Ron
text: Lenny's is our favorite subs shop. When the bread is fresh their 2nd to none..😍😍😍😆

name: Brian Hairston
text: I get the Philly Steak and Cheese every single time!

name: Nick Tucker
text: Last philly around.

name: Lorenzo Finley
text: Chicken Philly 🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥

name: Heather
text: No...just no.

name: DAVID Nelson
text: Good Philly steak and cheese very good
